Posts.Content: Hi.my shoulder on the op side gets a lot of pain..I thought it might be the netball but its not my throwing arm. I'm putting it down to the rads and letrozole...it comes and goes but it also clicks a lot so could be muscle strain? Maybe sees physio? That's my next step I think x
Posts.Title: Aches and pains ....... still!!!

Posts.Content: Hi...I ran a marathon last may 2 days after biopsy and diagnosis so I was fairly fit at the start of chemo. I did a fair bit of walking during chemo and I managed to do short runs in weeks 2 or 3 ( although they got shorter and slower). I have a treadmill at home which was a godsend as I didn't feel confident enough to run outside in case I felt rough. I managed to do a fairly slow 10k  3 months after radiotherapy and am now training for a half marathon  6 months post chemo. I also went back to playing centre in netball a month after treatment. Running has been my saviour throughout all this. However a word of caution....I know I rushed it as I was desperate to get back to normal....I was back teaching full time during radio and I still get very tired.  I have aches and pains which could be letrozole related or sports related and I often worry that the rib paiin is a spread! So sport is great but you will ache from it and it is just a little harder than before.   Although I am 46 now and still try to live like a 25 year old which is half the problem I think!! Do what your body can cope with and be kind to yourself xx
